required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Iron Supplementation in TAVI and SAVR Patients With Iron Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Clinical Trial of Intravenous Iron Supplementation in TAVI and SAVR Patients With Iron Deficiency

brief_summary.textblock: The INERTIA trial is a multicenter double-blinded randomized trial of intravenous iron supplementation in patients with severe aortic stenosis and iron deficiency undergoing TAVI or SAVR. The primary endpoint is the time to HF hospital admission or cardiovascular death. Secondary endpoints will assess quality of life indicators and functional capacity at 6 months.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two-arm trial of intravenous iron supplementation vs placebo, randomized 1:1.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with heart failure hospital admission or cardiovascular death

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of allogeneic RBC units received

secondary_outcome.description: Heart failure symptoms assessment. 0-100 scale, higher scores reflect better health status.
Patient reported outcome on the impact of the disease in daily live

Quality of life assessment in five dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems and extreme problems.

arm_group.description: Intravenous ferric carboxymaltose will be administered according to weight and hemoglobin values at randomization as follows: 2-4 weeks before valve intervention On the day of admission to valve intervention (if determined by dose calculation, otherwise placebo) 12 weeks after valve intervention (if iron deficiency persists, otherwise placebo)
Intravenous 0.9% NaCl (placebo) will be administered as follows: 2-4 weeks before valve intervention On the day of admission to valve intervention 12 weeks after valve intervention

intervention.description: Intravenous ferric carboxymaltose according to baseline weight and hemoglobin
